intro: Poikilospermum oblanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sand mat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit with small, narrow, oblanceolate leaves. The plant produces yellowish to brownish composite flowers, which are typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is well adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of study in ecological and botanical research.
